data.message:
We use Django where I work, I've had no problems finding python jobs in Egypt.

There may not be as many Python/Django jobs here, but they're definitely better paid because the supply is much lower than demand for python programmers here, especially if you're really good at it.
Atypical advice from me: Understand the underlying details, how stuff works, then it won't matter you should be able to switch between frameworks and languages on the fly.
